When you book through a third-party website, you are providing your personal information to that website, as well as the hotel. This means that your data is being shared with multiple entities, which can increase the risk of a data breach or misuse of your information.

On the other hand, when you book directly with the hotel, you are only providing your information to the hotel itself. This can help to reduce the risk of a data breach and ensure that your information is being handled by a single, reputable entity.

Additionally, booking directly with the hotel can offer other benefits, such as:

* More flexibility with cancellations or changes to your reservation
* The ability to earn loyalty points or rewards with the hotel's loyalty program
* Better communication with the hotel regarding any special requests or needs you may have
* A more personalized experience, as the hotel may have more information about your preferences and history with the property.

Overall, booking directly with the hotel can be a good choice for those who are concerned about privacy and want a more streamlined, personalized experience.
